sect1.title: Configuring the Boot Loader with &yast;
sect1.para:
2014-03-11 rsalevsky: Waiting for Beta3
The easiest way to configure general options of the boot loader in your &productname; system is to use the &yast; module. In the &yastcc;, select System Boot Loader. As in , this shows the current boot loader configuration of your system and allows you to make changes.

Use the Boot Loader Installation tab to view and change settings related to type, location and advanced loader settings. To use the &grub; boot loader, make sure it is selected from the list of available boot loaders.

sect2.title: Changing Boot Loader Type
sect2.para: Set the boot loader type in Boot Loader Installation. The default boot loader in &productname; is &grub;. To use &grub; or &elilo;, proceed as follows:

step.para: Select the Boot Loader Installation tab.
For Boot Loader, select &grub;, &elilo; or one of the other entries.
In the dialog box that opens, select one of the following actions:

listitem.para: Have &yast; convert the current configuration. When converting the configuration, some settings may be lost.
Write a custom configuration. This action is not available during the installation of &productname;.
Load your own boot loader configuration file. This action is not available during the installation of &productname;.

step.para: Click OK two times to save the changes.

sect2.para: During the conversion, the old &grub; configuration is saved to the disk. To use it, simply change the boot loader type back to &grub; and choose Restore Configuration Saved before Conversion. This action is available only on an installed system.

note.title: Custom Boot Loader
note.para: To use a boot loader other than the ones listed, select Do Not Install Any Boot Loader. Read the documentation of your boot loader carefully before choosing this option.

sect2.title: Modifying the Boot Loader Location
sect2.para: To modify the location of the boot loader, follow these steps:

step.para: Select the Boot Loader Installation tab and then choose one of the following options for Boot Loader Location:

listitem.para: This installs the boot loader in the MBR of the first disk (according to the boot sequence preset in the BIOS).
This installs the boot loader in the boot sector of the / partition (this is the default).
This installs the boot loader in the boot sector of the /boot partition.
This installs the boot loader in the extended partition container.
Use this option to specify the location of the boot loader manually.

step.para: Click OK to apply your changes.

sect2.title: Adjusting the Disk Order
sect2.para: If your computer has more than one hard disk, you can specify the boot sequence of the disks to improve the boot process. For more information look at .

step.para: Open the Boot Loader Installation menu.
If more than one disk is listed, select a disk and click Up or Down to reorder the displayed disks.
Click OK two times to save the changes.

sect2.title: Configuring Advanced Options
sect2.para: Advanced boot options can be configured via Boot Loader Installation Boot Loader Options.

listitem.para: Hides the boot menu and boots the default entry.

term.guimenu: Set Active Flag in Partition Table for Boot Partition

listitem.para: Activates the partition that contains the boot loader. Some legacy operating systems (such as Windows) can only boot from an active partition.

term.guimenu: Write Generic Boot Code to MBR

listitem.para: Replaces the current MBR with generic, operating system independent code.
Change the value of Time-Out in Seconds by typing in a new value and clicking the appropriate arrow key with your mouse, or by using the arrow keys on the keyboard.
Select the desired entry from the Default Boot Sectionlist. Note that the > sign in the boot entry name delimits boot section and its subsection.

When checked, the boot menu appears on a graphical splash screen rather than in a text mode. The resolution of the boot screen can be then set from the Console resolution list, and also graphical theme definition file can be specified with the Console theme file-chooser.
